```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
# create a random sample of size 10 from a standard Normal distribution
set.seed(111) # make sure to get the same result every time
random_norm = rnorm(10, mean = 0, sd = 1)

# create a  logical vector indicating whether elements of the sample are greater than 0
greater_than_0 = c(column1 > 0)

# create a character vector of length 10
favourite_fruits = c("Roxy's", "favourite", "fruits", "are", "apples", "strawberries", "mangos", "blueberries", "and", "avocados")
# check the length of the vector
length(favourite_fruits)

# create a factor vector of length 10, with 3 different factor “levels”
sweetness = c("30%_sugar", "sugar_free", "30%_sugar", "70%_sugar", "sugar_free", "30%_sugar", "sugar_free", "70%_sugar", "70%_sugar", "30%_sugar")
# check the length of the vector
length(sweetness)

#create the dataframe
df = data_frame(random_norm, greater_than_0, favourite_fruits, sweetness)
```

```{r}
# load the tidyverse package
library(tidyverse)

# try to take the mean of each variable in the dataframe
mean(pull(df, random_norm))

mean(pull(df, greater_than_0))

mean(pull(df, favourite_fruits)) # returns warning message: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA

mean(pull(df, sweetness)) # returns warning message: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA

# mean can be taken from numeric (random_norm) and logical (greater_than_0) variables, not characteristic (favourite_fruits and sweetness) variables
```
